thread.title: Mariah Carey plans to instill work ethic in her children | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Mariah Carey plans to instill work ethic in her children | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.Com Reporter
title: Mariah Carey plans to instill work ethic in her children | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'I don't want them to think since they're my kids and that they can just get whatever they want; do whatever they want,' she went on. 'I started saying, 'OK look, guys, here's what we're going to do, you're going to help out, maybe clean a couple of things.' I don’t expect it to be done properly,' she explained, of her method. And they're off: Carey is seen here with her five-year-old twins Moroccan and Monroe in Los Angeles on Sunday And the Infinity singer, who is dating dancer and choreographer Bryan Tanaka, loves being able to take her kids with her when she travels the world and always finds an activity in the city they're visiting that the kids will enjoy. 'For five-year-old kids, they’ve traveled more than most people in their lives, and they really love it,' Carey gushed. Usually we do something like go to a children's museum.' The Billboard Music Award winner also opened up about the close relationship she has with her former spouse, 36-year-old Cannon. Well-traveled: Carey gushed about how well-traveled her little ones are, seen in shopping in Beverly Hills on Saturday 'I support him in what he's going to do. He's the father of my kids,' she told Frazier. 'I don't know what's going on. I just know he's always going to be their daddy so that is what it is.' Meanwhile, even though the performer, who was recently engaged to Australian businessman and investor James Packer, has openly confirmed she is dating Bryan, she maintained she wants to keep her new relationship private. 'I'm just going to be like, 'I really don't talk about my personal life,' because that's what I used to do and it really worked for a minute, back, a while ago,' she said. 'I just don't feel comfortable talking about my personal life,' she stated. 'Me and my boyfriend don't want to do that.' More private approach: Even though the performer, who was recently engaged to Australian businessman and investor James Packer, has openly confirmed she is dating Bryan, she maintained she wants to keep her new relationship private
